body: @MatthiasHerp Did you get an error or something?

@MatthiasHerp Thanks for asking the question. You have to set the tracking URI too.

Here is a [Jupyter Example](https://github.com/dmatrix/google-colab/blob/master/mlflow_issue_3317.ipynb).

@harupy : there was no error message. the server works but doesn't go to the desired folder.

@dmatrix: thanks for the response and the example.
And sorry for the late response.

I tried the following Code:
(my URI is at : C:User/User/mah/Desktop/M5_Wallmart_Challenge)

import mlflow

mlflow.set_tracking_uri("file:///Desktop/M5_Wallmart_Challenge")

get_ipython().system_raw("mlflow ui --backend-store-uri file:///Desktop/M5_Wallmart_Challenge --port 5000 &")

But the Server still goes to the Default Location of the user: C:User/User/mah
@MatthiasHerp have you tried using `\` instead of `/` (because you're using windows)?

@harupy yes, then I get the error: 

<>:1: DeprecationWarning: invalid escape sequence \D
<>:1: DeprecationWarning: invalid escape sequence \D
<>:1: DeprecationWarning: invalid escape sequence \D
<ipython-input-3-b9629adec179>:1: DeprecationWarning: invalid escape sequence \D
  mlflow.set_tracking_uri("file:\\\Desktop\M5_Wallmart_Challenge")

@harupy I get the same error as above:

> <>:1: DeprecationWarning: invalid escape sequence \D
> <>:1: DeprecationWarning: invalid escape sequence \D
> <>:1: DeprecationWarning: invalid escape sequence \D
> :1: DeprecationWarning: invalid escape sequence \D
> mlflow.set_tracking_uri("file:\\Desktop\M5_Wallmart_Challenge")

I tried it with two or three slashes (/), as well as with User twice and one in the URI as you wrote above.
@MatthiasHerp sorry I have updated the command

The Code only run with / . Could It be something else. For example to run the Server I run 'mlflow ui' in the anaconda prompt powershell. I tired running it in the Default loacation (C:/User/mah) and in the specific Folder (C:/User/mah/desktop/M5_Wallmart_Challenge) but neither helped. Do I Need to deactivate the old server?
